{"step_by_step_thinking": "From the documents provided, it is clear that the periodontal ligament contains different types of nerve endings, macrophages, dendritic cells, progenitor cells, and connective tissue. The collagen, glycosaminoglycan, and insoluble glycoprotein components of the tissue were also investigated at different stages of development. In a histologic study of age changes in adult human periodontal joints, Sharpey's fibers, fibroblasts, and fat cells were observed. Based on this information, we can conclude that the predominant connective tissue cells of the periodontal ligament are...", "answer_choice": "B"}
